citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: Bering Sea Groundfish Database 1981

abstract.p: Bottom trawl position and catch data from the eastern Bering Sea, including exploratory and planned survey trawls. Data collected from government vessels, chartered commercial vessels and foreign vessels. The data set includes information obtained from groundfish trawl surveys, including cruise description, type of platform, time, sampling location, sampling gear, taxonomic composition of the catch, weight and number, sex and size, and more specialized observations that may include reproductive condition, age, and length-weight factors. Some data on the U.S. Exclusive Economic Zone are also included.
Data set consists of over 1,430,000 records from international waters and the U.S. EEZ (200-mile zone). Best standardized survey from 1982-present.
[References: Mintel, Ralph J. and Gary B. Smith. 1981. A description of the resource survey database system of the Northwest and Alaska Fisheries Center, 1981. NOAA/Tech. Mem. F/NWC-18.]

descript.purpose: To provide resource assessment estimates for management. Also includes biological data for additional studies and environmental data.
